abstract: As President Obama traveled to Wall Street on Monday and chided bankers for their recklessness, across town a federal judge issued a far sharper rebuke, not just for some of the financiers but for their regulators in Washington as well. Giving voice to the anger and frustration of many ordinary Americans, Judge Jed S. Rakoff issued a scathing ruling on one of the watershed moments of the financial crisis: the star-crossed takeover of Merrill Lynch by the now-struggling Bank of America.

lead_paragraph: As President Obama traveled to Wall Street on Monday and chided bankers for their recklessness, across town a federal judge issued a far sharper rebuke, not just for some of the financiers but for their regulators in Washington as well.

headline.main: Judge Rejects Settlement Over Merrill Bonuses

abstract: Robert J. McCann, the former head of Merrill Lynch’s wealth management unit, plans to ask a New York state judge on Wednesday to grant him ”emergency” relief that would force Bank of America to allow him take another job.
snippet: Robert J. McCann, the former head of Merrill Lynch’s wealth management unit, plans to ask a New York state judge on Wednesday to grant him ”emergency” relief that would force Bank of America to allow him take another job.
lead_paragraph: Robert J. McCann, the former head of Merrill Lynch’s wealth management unit, plans to ask a New York state judge on Wednesday to grant him “emergency” relief that would force Bank of America to allow him take another job.

headline.main: McCann Is Taking Aim at Bank of America in Court
